project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Apparently, if a Smart Commit is triggered by a Forked Repository, it won't trigger anything over JIRA side. In addition, the commit would not even count until other "not-forked" repo has a new commit against the JIRA ticket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Integrate JIRA with Bitbucket Server.
# Create a Repository on Bitbucket and fill in with some details (File and Commits)
# Make a smart commit towards a JIRA ticket like:
{code}ABC-1 #comment test{code}
# Fork the Repository.
# Do another smart commit in the Forked Repository working directory.
# Check that the new commit is added to Bitbucket side and it shows that it is linked to a JIRA Ticket.
# Navigate to JIRA and open the mentioned ticket.

h3. Expected Result:
There will be a Two comment with "Test" in JIRA Ticket.

h3. Actual Result:
There is only 1 comment with "Test" to be found.

h3. Notes:
# The commit count will show only 1
# Opening it will show 2 with the commit from the Forked Repository.
# Pushing a commit to the parent repository will update the count

h3. Environment:
# JIRA 7.5.1
# Bitbucket 5.0.1
fields.summary: Smart Commit did not work for Forked Repository

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If an instance has incorrect collation and the attachments with certain characters are attached, then this would be displayed in an incorrect way in the filesystem. Thereafter if the collation is fixed and the project with this attachment is tried to delete this shall cause the project to be failed to be deleted. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a checker in JIRA to check if any attachment has special characters created in incorrect collation and fix this automatically.

fields.description:
Some teams dislike that selecting one or more issues on a Board updates the URL to "follow" that issue around, for example clicking an issue on:

[https://jira.endurance.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1|https://jira.endurance.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1375]234

And the link changes:

[https://jira.endurance.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1234&selectedIssue=ABC-10|https://jira.endurance.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1375&selectedIssue=ESOSD-10965]0

Then, while moving around the board, the view will update to wherever that issue is, even if actions are being taken elsewhere (ranking issues, etc).

We'd like to see some sort of toggle that can be used to disable this "following" effect, so selecting issues on the Board does not continuously impact the view while taking actions unrelated to that issue. Thanks!
fields.summary: Option to disable direct issue in URL for Boards

fields.description:
Summary

When an issue is split, the remaining estimate of the issue is not adjusted to reflect the changes in the Original Estimate.

Steps to reproduce:

# Set a Scrum board to use Original Estimate with Remaining Estimate as Estimate option.
# Access the backlog and set an estimate of an issue to 2weeks (example). Both Original & Remaining Estimates will be 2w.
# Right-click on the issue and click Split.
# Set the name of the split issue and adjust the estimate of the issue (1w + 1w as an example).
# Click save and check issue detail view of both issues. The remaining estimate of the original issue will remain at 2w. 

 
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.5 and above. 


h3. Expected Results

The Remaining Estimate is updated to reflect the changes with the Original Estimate

Possible solutions:
* Automatically adjust the remaining estimate
* Let the user input the remaining estimate during the split action

 
h3. Actual Results

The Remaining Estimate is not updated to reflect the changes with the Original Estimate
 

h3.Workaround

Manually edit the Remaining Estimate
fields.summary: Remaining Estimate not updated with Split issue feature

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently, we cannot set a Story's Fix Version field from the Epic Link it was created.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
It would be great if JIRA can provide feature to set Fix Version automatically for each issue created under an Epic

h3. *Why this is important*
Currently, we will need to manually set fix version for each of the issue created by epic one by one which is time-consuming. Hence having a feature to automatically set the fix version of each created issue under and epic automatically will reduce lots of overhead work when using JIRA.
 
h3. *Workaround* 
Can use  Bulk Update the fixVersions of the issues linked to a certain Epic from time to time. It's still a manual action but it limits it to one action per Epic instead of changing the fixVersion of every single issue by hand.
fields.summary: Set Issue Fix Version from Epic Link

fields.description:
Large customers may see delays when using the DVCS connector, when it's connected to a GitHub Enterprise Server using LDAP for authentication.

When GHE encounters a request, it must authenticate the user first, which can cause a bottleneck. Using a personal token would eliminate the need for an LDAP lookup, which would increase throughput and remove a lot of delay.
fields.summary: It'd be nice to be able to use GitHub Personal Tokens with the DVCS connector

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Agile *board-scope-filter* is responsible for adding Board information into request scope. Method {{getContext}} is executed too many time which leads to performance overhead since it executes another methods later:
*  {{findRapidViewsByProject}}, see JSWSERVER-16130. 
* {{getIssueCountForProject}}, see JRASERVER-67442 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Put a breakpoint to {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl#getContext}}
# Load issue or Kanban board

h3. Expected Results
_getContext_ is executed only once. 

h3. Actual Results
* To load an issue, it is executed 2 times;
* To load a board, it is executed 2 times;
* To load a project,  it is executed 3-6 times;
* Switching from Backlog to Active Sprints or vice versa, it is executed 3 times;
 
h3. Notes
The current problem will be obsoleted after fixing JSWSERVER-19777.
The logic of board-scope-filter was simplified in Jira 8.1.0, and it will no longer cause a performance problem.

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: board-scope-filter executed too many time which leads to performance overhead

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When perform a quick searching by the issue key number, JIRA doesn't find the relevant issue if the issue's project is not being selected

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.5.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issues > Search for Issues
# From the Project drop down menu in the query bar, select one project
# After the list of issues is updated to display only the issues for the selected project, uncheck the selected project from the Project drop down so All project issues are displayed
# After the list of issues is updated to display issues from All projects, enter an issue number in the Search box that is from a project other than the one selected in step 2 above
# You should incorrectly receive a message that says "This issue can't be viewed"

h3. Suggestion
If the issue number from the quick search does not matches the last selected project then it should perform the search globally to match any issue that contained the issue key number.
fields.summary: quick searching doesn't find issue after changing from one project to All projects if issue is not in the originally selected project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We run JIRA Software Server connected to an Microsoft SQL Server (MSSQL) database. Every time we (re)start JIRA, we receive a warning (which we can ignore and continue):
{quote}Your mssql database is currently using an unsupported collation: Latin1_General_CI_AI. You should change this to a supported collation:
 * SQL_Latin1_General_CI_AI
 * SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI{quote}
However, when we created this database when we installed JIRA, we specifically created it with the Latin1_General_CI_AI collation, as instructed per [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2014-861253050.html], quote (step 1.1):
{quote}Collation type must be *case-insensitive*. We support '{{SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI}}' and '{{Latin1_General_CI_AI}}' as case-insensitive, accent-insensitive, and language neutral collation types.
{quote}
Note the _SQL__Latin1_General_CI_AI vs Latin1_General_CI_AI.

My suggestion would be to either:
 * Update the collation health checker to support Latin1_General_CI_AI; or
 * Update the documentation to suggest SQL_Latin1_General_CI_AI; or
 * (My favorite :) ) Both of the above, since JIRA seems to work absolutely fine with these collation settings.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Update supported MSSQL Collations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing a board's backlog, the *epic panel* is not populated and no *epic labels* are shown if the board's filter includes *Epic Link* conditionals.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Scrum project with sample data (*Test Project*)
 * Add two epics to the project (*TP-24,TP-25*)
 * Associate issues in active sprint to these epics
 * View backlog, see that epic panel is populated and epic labels are visible (*Board* > *Show epic labels*)
 * Edit filter for board to specifically filter for issues contained in the two epics (*project = TP AND "Epic Link" in (TP-24,TP-25) ORDER BY rank ASC*)
 * View backlog, observe that epic panel is blank and epic labels are NO LONGER present

h3. Expected Results

Expect to see epic information in epic panel & epic labels for issues when viewing issues in backlog.

h3. Actual Results
Epic data is omitted for the issues in the backlog, but is visible when viewing the active sprint.

h3.Workaround
Explicitly add the epics to the board filter: *project = TP AND ("Epic Link" in (TP-24,TP-25) OR issue in (TP-24,TP-25)) ORDER BY rank ASC*
fields.summary: Epic Panel/Labels not populated in backlog if board filter includes epic links

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status – 03 January 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi,

Thanks for all your votes and comments on this suggestion. I'm sorry we haven't provided feedback on it earlier. We fully understand the value it would provide to you.

The good news is that in the next Jira Server release you will find the "Development" column in Issue Navigator, which will contain the most important development information for an issue including commits, pull requests, builds and deployments.

Best,
 agenkin@atlassian.com
 Anton Genkin | Product Manager - Integrations
{panel}

Currently users have to visit an individual issue to see how many commits/reviews/etc. it's linked with. It would be great if they can search for issues in a Software project and have a column to show the overview of these data for each issue in Issue Navigator e.g. 2 commits, 1 review, and so on.

fields.description:
As quoted by official Samba4 sources ([https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/Updating_Samba#New_Default_for_LDAP_Connections_Requires_Strong_Authentication)] TLS encryption is enforced by now for binding. Since most admins do not open more ports than neccessary it is quite common to open only 389 and enforce TLS. Unfortunately JIRA offers only SSL (port 636) for AD user management. Me and my admin colleagues consider this as quite limiting and since security overules functionality this is quite a severe disadvantage. Is there any change of nearby implementation???

 
{code:java}
New Default for LDAP Connections Requires Strong Authentication
4.4.1 or later / 4.3.7 or later / 4.2.10 or later
The security updates 4.4.1, 4.3.7 and 4.2.10 introduced a new smb.conf option for the Active Directory (AD) LDAP server to enforce strong authentication. The default for this new option ldap server require strong auth is yes and allows only simple binds over TLS encrypted connections. In consequence, external applications that connect to AD using LDAP, cannot establish a connection if they do not use or support TLS encrypted connections.
Applications connecting to Samba AD using the LDAP protocol without encryption, will display the error message:
ldap_bind: Strong(er) authentication required (8) additional info: BindSimple: Transport encryption required.
For further information, see the 4.4.1, 4.3.7, or the 4.2.10 release notes.
{code}
Kind regards
fields.summary: TLS Support Samba4 Active Directory User Authentification

h3. Problem Definition
* You can add a URL custom field to a Kanban board card, however URLs in this field are not clickable from the card. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow such links to be clickable from the card to provide better usability. 

h3. Why this is important
* Users may sometimes have this URL field displayed on the card but not on the issue detail view. Which means if it's not clickable from the card, it wouldn't be clickable from the Issue Detail View either. 
* By making this link clickable a user will be saved an additional click to select the card and load the issue in the issue detail view from where the URL will then be clickable, provided they have the field on their View Issue screen.

h3. Workaround
* Add the URL field to the View Issue screen, and use the clickable link for this field in the JIRA Software Issue Detail view

fields.description:
h2. Created vs Resolved Issues Report generates a wrong JQL when clicking the link to list issues.

When set to a monthly period, the Created vs Resolved Issues Report generates a wrong JQL when clicking the link to list issues. See screenshots attached.

What happens is that the numbers on the report itself follow some sort of "sliding window" time frame. For example, if the report is set to grab the last 60 days, it looks like the report counts 60 running days backwards and generates the numbers based on that.

However, when you click on the number of created and resolved, JIRA generates a JQL that counts from day 1 of the first month and not effectively 60 days ago, increasing the numbers of issues listed. If you change the 'Period' setting from monthly to daily it is possible to see the first day that should be grabbed by the report.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Generate a 'Created vs Resolved Issues Report' and set it to use a 'Monthly' period with 'Cumulative Totals' set to 'no'.
# Click on the 'Created' or 'Resolved' number for the first month of the series, under 'Data Table'.

h3. Expected results
The list of issues should start from the correct period to match the graph

h3. Actual Results
The list of issues start from day 1 of that month instead.

h3. Workaround
Although this is not a workaround per se, one can manually adjust the JQL first date on the JQL that is generated upon clicking the number of issues on the graph.
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved Issues Report generates a wrong JQL when clicking the link to list issues.

h3. Summary
Jira software 7.5.0 Boards are not automatically prompting user to refresh when stale data exists

h3. Environment
Jira Software 7.5.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum board with sample data
# Configure Board to use swimlanes to sort issues by Assignee
# return to the board
# select an issue in an active sprint view
# in the Issue Details view, change the Assignee of the issue using the inline edit feature, confirm by clicking checkbox
# don't click anything else



h3. Expected Results
The board should either automatically refresh itself to reflect this change, OR it should eventually (about 30 seconds or so) show a popup warning in the bottom right of the page that the data on the view is stale and push the end user to refresh the page


h3. Actual Results
The user is not prompted to refresh the page, nor is the board automatically updated to reflect the change of the issue into a new swimlane

h3. Notes
This appears to be a regression of functionality that worked in Jira 7.2.7 and 7.4.2.  I have tested this in both older versions and at the very least we do see the prompt to refresh the page in those versions.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently {{findRapidViewsByProject}} scans all _RapidViews_ to find Boards which are related to specific project. That means that response time for the methods degrades with number of boards.
h3. Suggested Solution

There are a couple of ideas to improve the performance of the method:
 * Cache the results
 * Store reverse map of Boards which belongs to project.

h3. Workaround
Disable modules which triggers the method {{findRapidViewsByProject}}, see JSWSERVER-16717

h3. Decreased impact from 8.1
Starting from 8.1 we've severally decreased the number of times this method will be called decreasing it's impact. Before the fix this method was called on every page load. After the fix only when users click on the icon to see the boards: JSWSERVER-19777.
fields.summary: Performance of findRapidViewsByProject degrades with number of Boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If an Agile board has more than 1000 card colors, you will receive an ORA-01795 DB error when attempting to delete the board and deletion will fail.
h3. Environment

Observed with Oracle 12C using 12.1.102 driver
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure JIRA to use an Oracle 12 database
 # Create 1,000+ users
 # Create an Agile Board
 # Assign issues to each of the 1,000+ users.
 # Set card coloring rules: *Board* > *Configure* > *Card colors* > *Colors based on assignees*
 # Attempt to delete board

h3. Expected Results

Board should be deleted without error.
h3. Actual Results

Deletion fails, logging shows a DELETE SQL statement with more than 1,000 parameters for the IN clause:
{noformat}
/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidview/9501 [n.java.ao.sql] DELETE FROM "AO_60DB71_CARDCOLOR" WHERE "ID" IN (?,?,<snip>,?,?)
{noformat}
Resulting in stack:
{noformat}
/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidview/9501 [c.a.g.w.rapid.view.RapidViewResource] Unable to complete GreenHopper REST method 
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:Oracle
	- version:Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production
With the Partitioning, Real Application Clusters, Automatic Storage Management, OLAP,
Advanced Analytics and Real Application Testing options
	- minor version:1
	- major version:12
Driver:
	- name:Oracle JDBC driver
	- version:12.1.0.1.0
java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually delete card color entries in this board from the DB before removing board in UI:
{noformat}
DELETE FROM AO_60DB71_CARDCOLOR WHERE rapid_view_id = XXXX;
{noformat}
Where XXXX is the rapid board id as seen in the above stack trace, '9501' in this example.

 

Switching card coloring to a different type (Issue Types, Priorities, Queries, None) will not resolve the issue.
fields.summary: ORA-01795 Oracle DB Error when deleting a rapid board with >1000 card colors

{noformat}
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'trigger' of undefined
Resource: http://localhost:8750/jira750/s/2c589633efe04643049b2bf79a41f68b-CDN/-26tweq/75005/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/bda8e923c84da229719d334ebae8eeab/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,gh-rapid,jira.project.sidebar,com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.init,jira.global,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&is-server-instance=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&richediton=true

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The workflow metadata:
 * update author
 * update date

are not changed when the simplified workflow is modified by non-direct activity (ie: through Kanban board configuration). Although the workflow schema is updated correctly.
h2. Environment
 * JIRA version: 7.3.8
 * Default Kanban project

h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create new project from a Kanban model
 # Set a JIRA user as project lead.
 # As a JIRA user Add a new column on the Kanban board configuration with name "Custom1".

h2. Expected Results
 * New status "Custom1" has been added to JIRA statuses the related workflow
 * On the related "Issues > Workflows > View Workflow" screen the message box should display the correct information: "This workflow was last edited by <JIRA user> and <update date>"
 * "System > Audit log" should contain related update entry
 * Updated XML in the database (jiraworkflows table) with the proper data fields:
<meta name="jira.update.author.key"><JIRA user></meta>
<meta name="jira.updated.date"><update date></meta>

h2. Actual Results
 * New status "Custom1" has been added to JIRA statuses the related workflow
 * On the related "Issues > Workflows > View Workflow" screen the message box displays incorrect information: "This workflow was last edited by <origin creator> and <create date>" - update information is missing
 * Missing related entry in the "System > Audit log"
 * XML in the database (jiraworkflows table) contains incorrect data fields:
<meta name="jira.update.author.key"><origin creator></meta>
<meta name="jira.updated.date"><create date></meta>

h2. Notes

The date/author are updated correctly when the simplified workflow is edited directly by "Issues > Workflows > Edit Workflow".
h2. Workaround

No workaround found.
fields.summary: Simplified Workflow - the update date and author are not respected

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

JIRA 7.4 introduces Kanban backlog. With this feature, if a column has more than 20 issues, JIRA will show a pop-up asking user to enable Kanban Backlog:

 !Kanban Backlog.png|thumbnail! 

This pop-up can be dismissed but upon re-login and opening the Kanban board, the same pop-up will be displayed again.

Moreover when all issue status from the Kanban backlog column are moved to other columns, then the epics panel is disabled and a message pops up on the top right of the screen *Help us improve the Kanban backlog*:

 !Screenshot 2020-08-10 at 11.54.26.png|thumbnail! 

This is annoying also because it give to users the possibility to reach out to third party (in this case Atlassian :) and some Jira admin may want to disable this possibility for users.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow user to permanently dismiss the backlog pop-up


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Disable the Kanban Backlog messages and pop-up

fields.description:
I have upgraded my Jira server last week.

Today i was notified by one user that he cannot see any issues or projects.

The user belongs to a custom permission scheme i have created. When i try to edit the custom permission scheme the page is blank.

I tried to reindex the Jira server and when finished the problem remains.

I did an integrity check and everything is ok (passed)

I searched on your website and found [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/blank-page-when-trying-to-edit-permission-scheme-827110627.h...|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/blank-page-when-trying-to-edit-permission-scheme-827110627.html]

But when I tried the command "select * from schemepermissions where scheme = 10003 AND perm_type = 'reportercreate'"there are no results so the workaround will not apply as is the comment.

 

I urgently need help on this.

fields.description:
At present when you import a CSV file and want to establish a links relationship between issues you select the link name, 'Blocks' for instance.  I suggest we also let you select the type of link (inward or outward).

When you import the issues the default is to apply the 'outward description' to the imported issue, 'blocks' in this scenario. I suggest we add the ability to also select the 'inward description' as well. In this situation you could then say that the imported issue is 'blocked by' the referenced issue if that makes sense for the work.

The REST API offers this today - https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/issueLink-linkIssues
fields.summary: Add ability to select link as inward or outward when using CSV importer

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As per https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/server/#agile/1.0/board , it's currently not possible to rename boards via REST API

h3. Suggestion
Add official REST endpoint to allow rename of boards via REST API

h3. Workaround
Use the following (tested in JIRA 7.5.0)
* URL: /rest/greenhopoper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/name
* Method: PUT
* Data: 
{code}{
   "id":7,
   "name":"New Board Name"
}{code}
(i) Replace the board ID and new name accordingly. You can retrieve the board ID using *GET /rest/agile/1.0/board*
fields.summary: Ability to rename board via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When scrolling to the top of the backlog with a list of long issues in the backlog, the scroll bar hides behind the Sprint Header and obscures it from view. 

h3. Environment

Can be replicated in Google Chrome, Firefox and Safari. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or view a board with a long list of issues or resize the browser window vertically to reduce the available screen space. 
#  Create and start a Sprint so the sprint header appears at the top of the backlog. 
# Depending on the OS version, you may need to change system settings to 'Show Scroll bars: Always'. In Mac OS - System Preferences > General. 
# Scroll to the top of the backlog.
# Scroll all the way back up. 

h3. Expected Results

The scroll bar stops scrolling upwards once it reaches the sticky Sprint header. 

h3. Actual Results

Scroll bar continues scrolling and eventually hides behind the sprint header completely. 
 
h3. Notes

See recording here: [^Screen Recording 2017-09-19 at 05.19 PM.mov] 

h3.Workaround

1. Use mouse-wheel or track pad to scroll back down and bring the scroll bar into view. 

Or 

2. Add the following CSS to JIRA's [announcement banner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-an-announcement-banner-802592288.html]:

{code}
<style type="text/css">
.ghx-backlog-header.stuck{
position:absolute;
}
</style>
{code}

(!) Note that if a typo occurs, it may break access to JIRA (due to invalid or incomplete HTML). If you have problems immediately after adjusting the banner, you can follow [these steps to manually remove the banner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-jira-announcement-banner-through-the-database-429916703.html]. Please make sure that you test any changes in a staging environment and evaluate their impact before implementing in Production.
fields.summary: Scroll bar hidden by sprint header in backlog view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA Software, when using the release note creation feature, you have two options HTML or text.  When selecting the text option, the output can become full of lots of extra carriage returns and unneeded whitespaces


h3. Environment
Only when selecting the text output, the HTML output does not appear to be effected

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a software project
# make sure this project has at least 10 different issuetypes in it (the more issuetypes the project has, the easier it is to see this bug later)
# Then make sure that all the issues in the release are of just a single issue type
# create release notes


h3. Expected Results
text output contains all the issues in the release with minimal extra whitespaces


h3. Actual Results
It appears that the text output is creating a single carriage return for each issue type in the project, even if no issues of that type exist in the release.   


h3. Notes
This would be difficult to notice if you only had say 3-5 issuetypes in a project, but when you have 10-20 issuetypes in a project and the release only contains a single issue type, you can expect to see this specific problem.

h3.Workaround
* This appears to be governed by the <jira-application-dir>/WEB-INF/classes/templates/jira/project/releasenotes/releasenotes-text.vm 
* There looks to be an additional carriage return on line 40 of that template that is forcing this space in for each issuetype being looked for here.
fields.summary: Text output of release notes generates lots of extra whitespace when project has numerous unused issuetypes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JIRA 7.3.0 and earlier, user was able to print multiple cards from backlog and Active Sprint by selecting multiple issues and right-clicking to choose the "Print selected cards" option. In JIRA 7.3.6, the same feature is no longer available.

Steps to reproduce:

# Access a Scrum board.
# Click an issue, press Shift and proceed to select 2 other issues.
# Right click at one of the selected issue to see that print option is not shown.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.6, 7.4.3


h3. Expected Results

JIRA shows "Print selected cards" after user selects multiple issues from Backlog/Active Sprint


h3. Actual Results

JIRA does not shows "Print selected cards" after user selects multiple issues from Backlog/Active Sprint


h3.Workaround

{panel}
# Please click your Board's Board (top right) -> Configure -> Quick filter.
# From the quick filter, please add a filter which includes specific issue keys that you would like to print (eg: *issuekey in (TEST-1, TEST-2)*).
# Switch back to backlog view click on the newly created quick filter and click Board -> Print cards. This should allow you to print all the issues which is listed in the filter.
{panel}
fields.summary: Print selected cards option unavailable
